job.title: Test Automation Software Engineer
job.description:
Job Description
Important Note: During the application process, ensure your contact information (email and phone number) is up to date and upload your current resume when submitting your application for consideration. To participate in some selection activities you will need to respond to an invitation. The invitation can be sent by both email and text message. In order to receive text message invitations, your profile must include a mobile phone number designated as “Personal Cell” or “Cellular” in the contact information of your application.
At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired.
Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.
Technology sets IT strategy; enhances the design, development, and operations of our systems; optimizes the Wells Fargo infrastructure; provides information security; and enables Wells Fargo global customers to have 24 hours a day, 7 days a week banking access through in-branch, online, ATMs, and other channels.
Our mission is to deliver stable, secure, scalable, and innovative services at speeds that delight and satisfy our customers and unleash the skills potential of our employees.
This position will support the Credit and Retail Services businesses (Credit Card and Retail Services) within the Credit and Retail Services Technology organization. This position may also support other lines of business where shared platforms exist.
Card and Retail Services is a growth area within Wells Fargo. Key element of the growth strategy is to develop new credit card products and grow the Co-branded credit card portfolio. To enable the growth several Technology areas with Card Technology, Digital and Enterprise Technology have to come together to deliver E2E solution. This role will be well suited for an individual with proven success in strong technology delivery experience that has been gained on top of past hands-on technology solutions crafting and delivery. This role will partner with line of business partners and translate the business needs to various technology groups within Wells Fargo and Third Party Solutions providers and orchestrate activities to have End-to-End solutions in place and deliver it.
Primary Duties & Responsibilities
Lead software engineer in designing, coding, testing, debugging and documenting programs/test scenarios using Agile development practices
Provide cross-functional and cross-organizational coordination of end-to-end test automation for projects
Functional\Operational technical team lead for automated end-to-end testing leveraging the Wells Fargo Test Automation Framework
Primary point of contact and escalation point for automated testing needs
Partner with cross-organizational agile teams to ensure end-to-end test coverage is obtained
Prioritize the workload, assign engineers to projects, and provide monthly resource forecasts to project managers
Lead software engineers and Statement of Work (SOW) resources in automating end-to-end test scripts leveraging the agile methodology
Drive to resolve issues/impediments to keep the agile sprint schedule on track
Manage, coordinate, and communicate test virtualization solutions
Make enhancements to the test automation framework
Provide training/guidance to other cross-organizational agile teams in leveraging the Test Automation Framework
This position is NOT ELIGIBLE for relocation assistance. Prospective candidates should reside in and/or around the target site location or be able to commute to the site for employment.
Required Qualifications
5+ years of software engineering experience
3+ years of Java experience
3+ years of scripting and automation experience
Desired Qualifications
An industry-standard technology certification
Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Agile experience
Financial industry experience
Knowledge and understanding of secure SDLC (System Development Life Cycle) methodologies
Virtual leadership experience with ability to effectively drive results, provide feedback/direction, and manage and build relationships with leaders and team members in a geographically dispersed team environment
Other Desired Qualifications
Experience with Selenium, GIT HUB, TestNG, Jenkins, Eclipse Photon, ALM, and Maven software tools
Experience with Computer Associate's DevTest (Lisa) test virtualization tool
Experience in using Jira and Confluence
Job Expectations
Ability to work additional hours as needed
Salary Information
The salary range displayed below is based on a Full-time 40 hour a week schedule.
AZ-PHX-Northwest Phoenix:
Min: $84,000 Mid: $120,000 Max: $156,000
TX-Irving:
Min: $84,000 Mid: $120,000 Max: $156,000
PA-Philadelphia:
Min: $92,400 Mid: $132,000 Max: $171,600
AZ-Chandler:
Min: $84,000 Mid: $120,000 Max: $156,000

Disclaimer
All offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.
Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.
Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.
